reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms not the most luxurious but well looked after and very clean .they contained everything you needed for a comfortable stay.The staff from front of house to housekeeping were very polite and friendly .The concierge were extremely helpful .In fact nothing was to much trouble for the staff of this hotel.
reviews.title: A Great Place To Stay

reviews.text: Thank you for making our stay a very enjoyable experience
reviews.title: Excelsior Hotel, a great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Excelsior hotel for the whole month of January 2010. The location was great and close to many amenities. Many great restuarants around the hotel and the cafe on the 1st floor always offered great fresh food. The hotel is close to the subway and other public transportation so no location is to far to get to. If I travel to Hong Kong again, I would definitiely consider this location again.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, only thing missing is a swimming pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an efficient, busy hotel with good sized rooms for Hong Kong. Customer service is excellent in all departments. Excellent breakfast, freshly-squeezed juices, huge range of high quality food and no waiting for tables. The gym, bedroom and bathrooms are all well-appointed and very comfortable...gym is one of the best I've ever used in hotels. The location is great, next to the noon-day gun, also near an extensive shopping area. Go out of hotel front and turn right, walk about 200 metres for a great outdoor restaurant lane that seems relatively undiscovered. MTR is close by, near Sogo (go out of side door and turn left, keep walking). If no breakfast included then there is a starbucks opposite side entrance or a great illy coffee shop adjacent to ground floor lift lobby. We love this hotel for consistent high standards of service, facilities and location but the price is creeping up faster than for other similar well-appointed hotels with nice swimming pools. If you get a good deal then would recommend this but do check out competition. Great rooftop restaurant but pricey.
reviews.title: Very friendly hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated on the waterfront, very close to the metro and central to the major shopping area. Rooms are a little small and beginning to look a little dated but this is more than made up for by the excellent staff. The staff are all so helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them - especially on the front desk (they arranged a visa for China for our son at no cost above that of the visa itself).
reviews.title: Good hotel - but room for improvement.

reviews.text: I received exceptional customer service from the concierge desk. I could not ask for more.
reviews.title: Perfect location
Good hotel good location
reviews.text: Location-wise, it's only a few steps from the subway and bus stations. Stores and mall next door. Starbucks is across from the entrance. I had the buffet breakfast - was delighted at the variety!
Rooms were large enough, not at all small from what I read in other hotels' descriptions and I was given a free upgrade.
reviews.title: Nothing too much trouble

reviews.text: I was granted a late checkout but since my flight was not till 7pm, I came back to use the spa, with no issues.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.text: Will definitely stay here again when in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: The hotel is in the heart of Causway Bay...

reviews.text: I haven't stayed here for many years but returned over the New Year period. Stayed on the Exec floor and it is worth the extra money. The hotel is always busy but the Exec Club makes things just that little bit different.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in Causeway Bay

reviews.text: Evening drinks/canapes were always available and the Exec Floor staff really attentive. Dickens bar was great, as usual and the Hotel is in a very convenient position for MTR, Shopping etc
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.text: The staff were all so helpful and freindly.
reviews.title: The worst of Mandarin chains

reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in Aug. Yes it is dated and a bit tired but room was a good size and comfortable. Bathroom was huge although sliding doors and location next to bed a bit strange.
reviews.title: Great stay in HK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didn't eat in hotel as proximity to Causeway Bay excellent. Ability to walk just a few steps from hotel and straight into Sogo or MTR station was amazing. Also great for jumping on tram to get to Central. As we have spent a lot of time in Hong Kong before we didn't feel need to be in TST or Central but doesn't feel out of the way. Only a short walk to Times Square and lots of eating options. Supermarket around the corner and fast food everywhere. Hotel is definitely value for money.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our trip to China and the standout hotel out of the three we stayed at during our trip was the Excelsior in Hong Kong. What set it apart was the courteous staff, the excellent amenities and most of all, the convenient location of the hotel.
reviews.title: The Excelsior Lived Up to Its Name

reviews.text: The Excelsior is located on Hong Kong Island in an area called Causeway Bay, it is the epicenter of shopping, great dining and nightlife. It is also very conveniently located near an MTR station, Kong Kong's subway system.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for... a good value in HK, not much else
Good Experience
reviews.text: What truly makes the hotel excellent is the way the staff will go out of their way to make you comfortable. A great example is our check in process. We arrived on an early morning flight -- about 5:30am. By the time we got through customs and immigration and arrived at the hotel, it was not later than 7am. Check in is not until 3pm. We prepared ourselves to check our luggage at the bell desk and wait until we had rooms so we could get some rest after our long overseas flight. When we arrived at the lobby desk we gave our check in information to the friendly English-speaking employee and were checked in immediately -- no questions asked. We were handed hotel room keys and within no time at all were resting quite comfortably in our room before 7:30am!
All staff that we encountered spoke English to some degree. This greatly helped us ease into our transition while staying in a foreign country.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast buffet they offer is a little pricey, but worth it! For those of us missing a western-style breakfast, their offerings were exactly what we needed to help us get over our chinese-cuisine overload! It had eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, fresh fruit and french press coffee, all the comforts of home and it also had items from a traditional Chinese and Japanese breakfast. Top that all off with a fresh squeeze juice bar and you've got a world class treat!
reviews.title: Really pleased with Excelsior

likes.disliked: — Band playing in the top floor bar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can’t rave enough about the excellent care and advise that the staff at the Excelsior Hotel provided. From the run-of-the-mill dinner recommendations to finding us local fight tickets, they went out of their way to make sure that we found what we needed.
reviews.title: Excellent, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were clean – and all amenities ‘fit’ my very tall husband. We somehow got stuck on a smoking floor – and I never remembered to ask for a room change. If I went again, I’d make sure that we were on a higher floor.
reviews.title: Great start to our honeymoon

reviews.text: Location was great, taxis abundant and great food within walking distance.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.text: This was our first stop on our 4-week honeymoon enroute to Sydney. As this was effectively a "city break" within our overall holiday the hotel was perfectly positioned in Causeway Bay, had adequate facilities including bars and restaurants and had good service. A good solid all rounder for a fun city break in HK.
reviews.title: Great for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whenever I am in Hong kong, i always stay in Excelsior hotel in causeway bay. location-wise,it is very convenient, supermarekts, MTR, bus stops, malls, restaurants are within the vicinity. The rooms are clean, the fixtures also(some hotels get renovated but skip to change the fixtures, eg. shower, faucets, lighting), but the room is quite small compared to others.they have friendly staffs too. overall"excellent
reviews.title: We Loved the Excelsior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised at location. Loads of activity right on the doorstep, very close to MTR so easy to get around.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had superior side harbour view on floor 28 (no. 2827). Looked recently decorated, clean, tidy and reasonable size, neither huge nor small. Bathroom somewhat compact but I've seen smaller! Fridge, mini bar, coffee/tea facility, safe, hairdryer (very good), iron and board, TV, digital clock. Checked in at 11am and only twin bedroom available - wasn't bothered. Very quiet located room, no traffic noise.
reviews.title: Love the Excelsior...and the location too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loads of dressing table surface and well lit. UK style sockets.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Check out was noon, extended free 'til 2pm. After this luggage was stored with porters and we were given use of gym facilities to shower/change prior to 8pm pick up for 11.30 flight. Retrieved the bag with change of clothing etc from porters at appropriate time in the evening, no problem. Towels/tissues/hairdryers/deodorant/shower gel/shampoo all supplied in the gym. One couple given the use of an available room by reception for 1 hour during the evening instead of the gym, but gym facilities so good it didn't make much difference which you used.
reviews.title: Well worth the money! Excellent!

likes.liked: — Great rooms and easy access to MTR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After changing into travel clothes wanted to stay 'cool' so went down into hotel Dickens Bar for 'English' meal and a few drinks. Bit smokey but service pretty prompt and not too bad value. Watch out as steak & kidney pie is the size of a dinner plate, which is why it doesn't come with any potatoes/veggies! Cafe on 1st floor a trifle expensive but can recommend club sandwich, freshly made. Coffee shop egg tarts - fantastic. Didn't sample any other restaurants in hotel so can't comment on those.
reviews.title: Fabulous bar view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great central location. It overlooks the harbour, which is nice, but we wouldn't necessarily pay the extra for this feature again (although it is nice at nighttime). At the back of the hotel is the main shopping district which was great and the MTR (tube station) is right next to the hotel which is handy.
reviews.title: Pretty Plush

likes.disliked: — no breakfast included in the price

reviews.text: The room and facilities at the hotel are really good - gym especially was a bonus, although there is no pool. We were a little disapointed breakfast wasn't included in the price of the room - and for the price you pay i would expect this usually. A cafe in the shopping mall opposite was fine though.
reviews.title: Sufficient Hotel for Business or Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. We opted to get the shuttle bus to and from the airport - we found that this was the cheapest option and the most hassle free as it is door to door. The staff were quick and efficient at booking the shuttle and it arrived on time.
reviews.title: Good hotel and good service.

reviews.text: We felt it a good sign when a coach load of cabin crew from a national airline turned up and checked into the same hotel (separate check in desk to avoid long queues). The airline obviously has a choice and choose to repeat its custom with Excelsior
reviews.title: Great location

likes.liked: — Great location in Causeway Bay Area

reviews.title: Not so good location
reviews.text: I've stayed here many times...Decent location with all of the Causeway Bay shopping behind the hotel without the hustling that you find in Tsim Sha Tsui...But the MTR station is a 2-min walk, connecting you to the rest of Hong Kong/Kowloon in just a few minutes. Clean, comfortable rooms with a good staff. The Italian restaurant in the hotel has decent food. Executive floor rooms offer a decent breakfast and great 'cocktail hour' with hot appetizers and a staff that really makes you feel welcome and seems to cater to your every need.

There is no better location than this hotel in HK! Though room is a bit old, check in takes a long time and room is not ready when check in...I still love it because you can just step out of the hotel and find everything from food, shopping to entertainment at your finger tips!
reviews.title: Excellent location for the shopping and dining experience in Causeway Bay, especially for the night owls!

reviews.text: Best view ever to see the countdown firework on New Year eve too....
reviews.title: Standard hotel

reviews.text: If you are not spending too much time in the hotel (who does that in HK anyway?) stay here and you will know what I meant!
reviews.title: Perfect for business

reviews.text: Concierge service is a plus - for arranging my airport shuttle bus at only HKD150, on time, hassle free!
reviews.title: A nice place for business traveller

reviews.text: I stayed here for couple of nights due to business. I did not know anything of the hotel before my visit, booking was done by local associates.
reviews.title: Homely if not a little tired.

reviews.text: This is a good value hotel if you are on business and need a clean hotel at a more reasonable rate than Mandarin, Four Seasons etc
reviews.title: Good Value
Good Hotel
reviews.text: Rooms are not spacious but not cramped either. Service is good but check-in can be very busy at times. Arriving by taxi you have to wait in many cases since the area is very cramped with cars and the taxis are not allowed to stop on the road outside of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Views. If you are a tourist in HK, ask for rooms with a view. Many of the rooms are facing directly into the building next door(just a couple of meters) with no view whatsoever. Since I go to HK frequently this is of no sigificance for me but I can imagine it being a disappointment for first time visitors.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

likes.disliked: — Althought the area is good, it's not for someone who wants a more central base

reviews.text: I stayed there for 7 nights (8th Oct - 14th Oct 2007) in an Executive Suite. I would say my overall experience was good. I am impressed with the room size, cleanliness, amenities and the view. I felt comfortable, relax and always look forward to coming back to the room after a long day outside. It was excellent.
reviews.title: Happy with Excelsior

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative comment I have is regarding the daily fruit basket that was in my room. The first 2 days was good in terms of quantity, variety and presentation. After that the fruits delivered to my room is not in its basket anymore. The quantity and variety is not there. The fruit was just "chuck" on a tray and one day there was no knife given! I called to complain on the knife. The next day, the presentation is back. Phew!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.disliked: — fully aware we had two people staying but only provide one person with free buffet breakfast - minor(as it doesn't cost much) but can do better.

reviews.text: Decent 4-star-ish hotel, located in Causeway Bay very close to Victoria Park, Times Square and other shopping. Rooms are compact and tired but sufficient, and have the damp smell many reviewers have mentioned. Not over-powering, the smell hits you when you enter but you get used to it soon. LCD TV and Ipod dock look like recent upgrades. Small bathroom also needs up-gradation, slight smell there too.
reviews.title: A well-priced, well-located hotel, not Mandarin Oriental standard though

reviews.text: Otherwise, the service is good, the price is reasonable for Hong Kong (I paid around US$170+ B&B), and the breakfast buffet is excellent. Their food outlets seem pretty good too - there's a nice rooftop bar/restaurant with a great view over town, and the Dickens bar in the basement is friendly and atmospheric, and gets quite active when a game's on (I watched a World Cup Football match there).
reviews.title: Only Business

reviews.text: Close to the Causeway Bay subway station, and taxis are pretty reasonably priced anyway. Cab to Airport Express Central station costs about 35 HKD. Internet is expensive at 35 HKD/hour.
reviews.title: My favourite hotel in Hong Kong

reviews.text: Not a luxury hotel, but quite ok for a short stay for some shopping and entertainment.
reviews.title: convenient location and excellent service

reviews.text: The Hotel is well placed in Central Business district, had everything what is needed for a business trip. The staff are very accomodative and is also at the heart of Causeway Bay.
reviews.title: One man's meat is another man's poisson

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights, the room was clean and comfort. The hotel is known that has a delicious breakfast in Hong Kong, many choice from chinese to western. pure juice is good to, you can combined 2 or more fruits and they will served it to you.The hotel is located in great area, many shopping mall is around it. Just a minute walk beside or behind the hotel.
reviews.title: great breakfast, good sleep

reviews.text: Stayed at the Excelsior, as our company conference was there also.
reviews.title: not particularly flash, but good attention to detail

reviews.text: Rooms were a good size for HKG, and the rates were about average -but could have included breakfast for the rate i felt.
reviews.title: Good but not great, beware front desk congestion and noisy plumbing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly check in, though couldnt get in room until 13h00, which was a touch annoying after a 13 hour flight, but bags were looked after fine while we went back out.
reviews.title: I've been so fortunate lately ...

reviews.text: Small details were what caught my attention, and were a very pleasant surprise. I left three books out on the bedside table in the morning- when i got back to the room after the day's meetings, three hotel bookmarks had been placed next to them. Bottles of water ( free ) were always replaced, no exceptions. Room was always serviced swiftly while out at breakfast. Staff always greeted guests, and help with anything was always available.
reviews.title: Convenient location, good value.

reviews.text: Love this hotel. The staff is always responsive and very polite. I always stay here whenever I travel to Hong Kong. Great locations as well. Try their restaurant, Yee Tung Heen was sublime.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Reception: Small area which gets crowded regularly especially with so many air crew arrivals. During my stay it was not helped by an enourmous Christmas Tree and a shed sized Gingerbread house, must admit they looked great. The staff however were very efficient and checking us all in and arranging to have luggage delivered to the room.
reviews.title: Best location, some great staff, poor rooms

reviews.text: Rooms: Very very VERY dated. Apart from the flat screen TVs and iPod docking station these rooms are in dire need of an update. The wood effect is very Ninties and the whole effect is very cluttered. The bed was comfortable enough however the pillows were very hard. I was also placed right beside the house keeping store room and was disturbed as early as 6am with chatter and noise from it. I could also here the person in the room next to me as I was given an adjoining room. I found the bathroom not to be the cleanest especially around the bath tub and toilet. The climate control in the room was not very effective. I could not get the temperature down to a cool level and the windows did not open. Alas I had no view this time around although I have been in rooms before with a lovely view of the harbour.
reviews.title: First Class Service, First Class stay

reviews.text: Gym: Excellent gym with a spacious and well equipped layout. The staff were very friendly in offering to show me the facilities. However I though the charge to grab an apple from the basket on the reception counter was a bit much. (You soon learn that EVERYTHING is charged at this hotel).
reviews.title: Dated Hong Kong classic

reviews.text: Bar: I went for a few drinks in the Dickens bar the first night I was there. I was APPALLED at the prices. I rarely expect to pay more then Dublin prices for a pint but my god they make Ireland look cheap in this place. On top of that the staff behind the bar are perhaps the rudest bar staff I have ever encountered. Not just this time but when I think about it, they have been rude everytime I have visited. On this occassion they just stood behind the counter busying themselves with cleaning glasses and not making eye contact with any customers until you literally had to shout at them to get any attention, and Im too polite to shout. When I asked what beers they had they simply shoved a menu in my face instead of just telling me, then disappeared off before giving me a chance to make a selection leaving me there for another 5 minutes before I could get their attention again. I have subsequently found a number of atmospheric bars in the area who do not over charge and actually have amazing views over the harbour so I shall be frequenting them instead.
reviews.title: Our favourite in Hong Kong
